Main symptoms include persistent low mood, described as a heaviness in his chest, moderate to severe in severity, worse in the mornings, and temporary improvement when with family. Accompanying symptoms include low self-esteem, self-blame, occasional suicidal thoughts (denies plans or intent), poor concentration, difficulty sleeping (insomnia), and decreased appetite. He visited a family physician 4 months ago and was prescribed antidepressants with minimal relief and attended 3 sessions of cognitive-behavioral therapy with limited success. His general condition changes include a depressed mental state, disrupted sleep with frequent awakenings, reduced appetite, normal urination and defecation, and minor unintentional weight loss (~5 lbs).
